meanings.definition: A curve formed by the intersection of a plane with a cone when the plane is parallel to one of the sides of the cone.
meanings.sent1: The conchoids beautifully illustrate the meeting of a plane and a cone.
meanings.sent2: Math students learn about conchoids in geometry class.
meanings.sent3: The conchoids danced gracefully on the paper, showing the cone's influence.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts followed the conchoids of logic, intersecting at precise points.
meanings.sent5: The conchoids resembled elegant ribbons, wrapping around the cone with precision.

meanings.definition: A curve formed by the intersection of a plane with a cone when the plane is not parallel to any of the sides of the cone.
meanings.sent1: The conchoids created a unique shape where the plane and cone met at an angle.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study conchoids to understand complex geometric relationships.
meanings.sent3: The conchoids seemed to play hide and seek with the cone, never quite touching.
meanings.sent4: His words followed the conchoids of the conversation, intersecting at unexpected points.
meanings.sent5: The conchoids twisted and turned, creating a mesmerizing pattern where they met the cone.
